discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
To load files whose metadata has expired, set the LOAD_UNCERTAIN_FILES copy option to true. The copy option references load metadata, if available, to avoid data duplication, but also attempts to load files with expired load metadata.

Selected Answer: A
To load files whose metadata has expired, set the LOAD_UNCERTAIN_FILES copy option to true. The copy option references load metadata, if available, to avoid data duplication, but also attempts to load files with expired load metadata.

Alternatively, set the FORCE option to load all files, ignoring load metadata if it exists. Note that this option reloads files, potentially duplicating data in a table.

Selected Answer: A
A is correct

Selected Answer: A
Answer is A

Selected Answer: B
B correct - Boolean that specifies to load all files, regardless of whether they’ve been loaded previously and have not changed since they were loaded. Note that this option reloads files, potentially duplicating data in a table.

https://docs.snowflake.com/en/sql-reference/sql/copy-into-table

questions.question_text: While attempting to avoid data duplication, which COPY INTO [location] option should be used to load files with expired load metadata?
What service is provided as an integrated Snowflake feature to enhance Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA) support?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A is correct

Selected Answer: A
A correct - MFA provides increased login security for users connecting to Snowflake. MFA support is provided as an integrated Snowflake feature, powered by the Duo Security service, which is managed completely by Snowflake.

https://docs.snowflake.com/en/user-guide/ui-snowsight-profile

questions.question_text: What is the impact on queries that are being executed when a resource monitor set to the “Notify & Suspend” threshold level is exceeded?

choices.B: All statements being executed are restarted.
choices.D: All statements being executed are completed.
choices.A: All statements being executed are queued.
choices.C: All statements being executed are cancelled.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
D is correct

Reference: https://docs.snowflake.com/en/user-guide/resource-monitors

Selected Answer: D
D correct - Notify & Suspend

 Send a notification (to all account administrators with notifications enabled) and suspend all assigned warehouses after all statements being executed by the warehouse(s) have completed.
Notify & Suspend Immediately

 Send a notification (to all account administrators with notifications enabled) and suspend all assigned warehouses immediately, which cancels any statements being executed by the warehouses at the time.

Notify & Suspend
Send a notification (to all account administrators with notifications enabled) and suspend all assigned warehouses after all statements being executed by the warehouse(s) have completed.

Notify & Suspend Immediately
Send a notification (to all account administrators with notifications enabled) and suspend all assigned warehouses immediately, which cancels any statements being executed by the warehouses at the time.

Notify
Perform no action, but send an alert notification (to all account administrators with notifications enabled).

questions.question_text: What tasks can an account administrator perform in the Data Exchange? (Choose two.)

choices.E: Transfer ownership of a provider profile.
choices.C: Approve and deny listing approval requests.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AC
AC correct 
By default, only an account administrator (a user with the ACCOUNTADMIN role) in the Data Exchange administrator account can manage a Data Exchange, which includes the following tasks: Add or remove members. Approve or deny listing approval requests. Approve or deny provider profile approval requests.

docs.snowflake.com/en/user-guide/data-exchange-marketplace-privileges

Selected Answer: AC
Add or remove members. 
Approve or deny listing approval requests. 
Approve or deny provider profile approval requests.

questions.question_text: Which types of subqueries does Snowflake support? (Choose two.)

choices.B: Uncorrelated scalar subqueries in any place that a value expression can be used
choices.D: EXISTS, ANY / ALL, and IN subqueries in WHERE clauses: these subqueries can be correlated only
choices.E: EXISTS, ANY / ALL, and IN subqueries in WHERE clauses: these subqueries can be correlated or uncorrelated
choices.A: Uncorrelated scalar subqueries in WHERE clauses
choices.C: EXISTS, ANY / ALL, and IN subqueries in WHERE clauses: these subqueries can be uncorrelated only

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BE
BE correct

Snowflake currently supports the following types of subqueries:

 Uncorrelated scalar subqueries in any place that a value expression can be used.

 Correlated scalar subqueries in WHERE clauses.

 EXISTS, ANY / ALL, and IN subqueries in WHERE clauses. These subqueries can be correlated or uncorrelated.

https://docs.snowflake.com/en/user-guide/querying-subqueries
